newsitem.title: GREECE: GREEK POLICE OFFICERS UNION UNHAPPY WITH PAY POLICY.
newsitem.headline: GREEK POLICE OFFICERS UNION UNHAPPY WITH PAY POLICY.

text.p: Greece's union of police officers (PENAA) on Thursday expressed its disappointed because none of its proposals on pay policy were accepted by the government, it said in a statement.
The government's new salary structure for security and armed forces personnel was passed in parliament Wednesday evening.

"Once more, we express our disappointment because none of our proposals were accepted by the government. As a result, instead of an expected pay rise, citizens in uniform are now pondering how much their real incomes will fall," PENAA said. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
